body:
### Steps to reproduce

This is happening across our autamus builds - you can see the full output here https://github.com/autamus/registry/runs/3852451587?check_suite_focus=true and I'm attaching an example Dockerfile to reproduce (a different package but same error).
```dockerfile
# Build stage with Spack pre-installed and ready to be used
FROM ghcr.io/spack/ubuntu-bionic:latest as builder

ADD repo /opt/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/

# Install OS packages needed to build the software
RUN apt-get -yqq update && apt-get -yqq upgrade \
 && apt-get -yqq install python3-boto3 python3-dev gringo \
 && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# What we want to install and how we want to install it
# is specified in a manifest file (spack.yaml)
RUN mkdir /opt/spack-environment \
&&  (echo "spack:" \
&&   echo "  specs:" \
&&   echo "  - caliper" \
&&   echo "  view: /opt/view" \
&&   echo "  packages:" \
&&   echo "    all:" \
&&   echo "      target:" \
&&   echo "      - x86_64_v3" \
&&   echo "  config:" \
&&   echo "    concretizer: clingo" \
&&   echo "    compiler:" \
&&   echo "      target:" \
&&   echo "      - x86_64_v3" \
&&   echo "    install_missing_compilers: true" \
&&   echo "    install_tree: /opt/software" \
&&   echo "  mirrors:" \
&&   echo "    autamus: s3://autamus-cache" \
&&   echo "  concretization: together") > /opt/spack-environment/spack.yaml

# Install the software, remove unnecessary deps
RUN cd /opt/spack-environment && . /opt/spack/share/spack/setup-env.sh && spack env activate . && curl http://s3.amazonaws.com/autamus-cache/build_cache/_pgp/FFEB24B0A9D81F6D5597F9900B59588C86C41BE7.pub > key.pub && spack gpg trust key.pub && spack install --fail-fast --monitor --monitor-save-local --monitor-tags autamus; stat=$?; cd ~/.spack/reports/monitor/; tar -czvf monitor.tar.gz *; curl -F "upload=@monitor.tar.gz" http://localhost:4500/upload; exit $stat && spack gc -y; 

# Strip all the binaries
RUN find -L /opt/view/* -type f -exec readlink -f '{}' \; | \
    xargs file -i | \
    grep 'charset=binary' | \
    grep 'x-executable\|x-archive\|x-sharedlib' | \
    awk -F: '{print $1}' | xargs strip -s

# Modifications to the environment that are necessary to run
RUN cd /opt/spack-environment && \
    spack env activate --sh -d . >> /etc/profile.d/z10_spack_environment.sh


# Bare OS image to run the installed executables
FROM ubuntu:18.04

ENV PATH=/opt/view/bin:/opt/spack/bin:$PATH

COPY --from=builder /opt/spack-environment /opt/spack-environment
COPY --from=builder /opt/software /opt/software
COPY --from=builder /opt/view /opt/view
COPY --from=builder /etc/profile.d/z10_spack_environment.sh /etc/profile.d/z10_spack_environment.sh

ENTRYPOINT ["/bin/bash", "--rcfile", "/etc/profile", "-l", "-c"]
```
cc @alecbcs 


### Error message

```console
 #13 2.514 ==> Error: cannot bootstrap the "clingo" Python module from spec "clingo-bootstrap@spack+python %gcc target=x86_64" due to the following failures:
#13 2.514     'github-actions' raised ImportError: cannot import name 'architecture'
#13 2.514     Please run `spack -d spec zlib` for more verbose error messages
------
```

### Information on your system

See container.

### General information

- [ ] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [ ] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output
title: Clingo bootstrap "cannot import name architecture"
